title: Iran’s Leaders Turn to a New Brand of Nationalism After Israeli and U.S. Attacks
summary: The theocratic government is repurposing folklore and patriotic anthems as it seeks to channel national outrage into increasing its support at home.

title: Conviction Reversed in Etan Patz Case That Put Focus on Missing Children
summary: Pedro Hernandez, a former bodega stock clerk, had confessed years after the 1979 crime to luring Etan Patz, 6, into a basement in SoHo. The case shook New York City.

title: A Timeline of the Etan Patz Case
summary: It has been 46 years since 6-year-old Etan Patz disappeared in SoHo. After a lawsuit and two criminal trials, questions remain about how he died.

title: Trump Releases Thousands of Martin Luther King Jr. Files
summary: Historians said they saw little of note in the assassination records that President Trump disclosed despite opposition from most of Dr. King’s family.

title: Judge Sentences Ex-Officer in Breonna Taylor Raid to Nearly 3 Years in Prison
summary: The sentence was a sharp rebuke to the Trump administration, which had requested he serve only one day behind bars.

title: TV Show Helps Identify Mother and Child Found Dead in Rome Park, and a Suspect
summary: When two bodies were found in a popular Roman park, Italians wanted answers. A TV program specializing in missing people helped identify them, and a suspect.

title: Johnson Says He Won’t Hold Vote Calling on Trump to Release Epstein Files This Summer
summary: The Republican speaker of the House had said last week that the government should release “everything” in the Jeffrey Epstein files, in a rare break with the president that turned out to be short-lived.

title: Trump Talks About Anything but Epstein on His Social Media Account
summary: On Truth Social, the president railed against Democrats and shared a wacky video.

title: White House Bans Wall Street Journal From Press Pool on Trump’s Scotland Trip
summary: The president sued the publication last week, accusing it of defamation for an article about his ties to the disgraced former financier Jeffrey Epstein.

title: Trump Sharpens Attacks on a Favorite Foe: The News Media
summary: How the president is using the levers of government power against the news industry.

title: Malcolm-Jamal Warner, Theo Huxtable on ‘The Cosby Show,’ Dead at 54 After Drowning
summary: Mr. Warner, who played the only son of Bill Cosby’s character on the beloved 1980s sitcom, drowned in Costa Rica.

title: China’s Problem With Competition: There’s Too Much of It
summary: The Chinese government is taking steps to rein in what it calls “involution,” or excessive competition that is hurting local companies and fueling the country’s deflationary spiral.

title: Big Law Firms Bowed to Trump. A Corps of ‘Little Guys’ Jumped in to Fight Him.
summary: Solo practitioners, former government litigators and small law offices stepped up to help challenge the Trump administration’s agenda in court after the White House sought to punish many big firms.

title: States Sue Over Unauthorized Immigrants’ Access to Federal Programs
summary: The suit comes after several federal agencies said they would no longer allow unauthorized immigrants to benefit from more than a dozen health and education programs.

title: Italian Americans, for and Against Mamdani, Square Off in New York
summary: Feelings ran high at a colorful protest outside the Assembly district office of Zohran Mamdani, the Democratic mayoral nominee.

title: Hunter Biden Trashes Democrats, Including George Clooney, in Podcast Appearances
summary: In a profane tirade, the former president’s son sought to settle scores with Anita Dunn, David Axelrod, James Carville and George Clooney. Among others.

title: Minnesota Lawmaker Convicted of Burglary Plans to Resign
summary: Democrats would have lost their majority with the senator’s resignation, but a Republican’s death left the balance of power in St. Paul unchanged.

title: Texas Republicans Look to Jam Democrats With Vote on Redistricting
summary: By taking up new congressional maps pushed by President Trump first, Republicans hope to discourage Democrats from walking out of a special session before they vote on flood relief.

title: Hegseth Attends Meeting on Ukraine After Skipping Last Session
summary: The defense secretary’s attendance may signal a turnaround as President Trump’s tone shifts on his willingness to support Kyiv against Moscow.

title: ‘KPop Demon Hunters’ Directors Discuss the Film’s Rise and Chart-Topping Soundtrack
summary: Maggie Kang, a director of the hit along with Chris Appelhans, was “just trying to make something that I wanted to see: a movie that celebrated Korean culture.”

title: The Perverse Economics of Assisted Suicide
summary: In an aging world, assisted suicide may look to governments like a cost-saving measure.

title: The Coldplay Concert Shame Is Something to Celebrate
summary: In the age of Trump, it’s a strange relief to see two fellow citizens seem to realize that they have done something reckless and inappropriate.

title: 2 Dead and 1 Missing After Plunging From Oregon Waterfall, Officials Say
summary: Three other people were rescued on Saturday when a group of people strayed into an unsafe section of the Deschutes River near Bend, Ore., the authorities said.

title: 5 Million Pools Are Recalled After at Least 9 Children Drown
summary: Children have been able to climb into the aboveground pools by using a compression strap on the outside as a foothold, the U.S. Consumer Product Safety Commission said.

title: When Betelgeuse Explodes, It’s Going to Take Out Another Star
summary: The tempestuous star in Orion’s shoulder has a buddy, and neither of their futures look bright.

title: Sharing a Bed With Your Kid? It’s Totally Normal in Asia.
summary: Bed sharing tends to be unpopular and contentious in the United States. But in many Asian countries, the question is often not whether to do it, but when to stop.
